commit_message:
Enhance doc contribution guidelines

Enhance greatly the current documentation contribution
guidelines and make necessary changes to associated
documents.

Change-Id: I29ba4ef3a74f183539ada968d48e7c5a2f4ca814
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/36/832336/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Documentation for the OpenStack Charms project uses the `Docs as Code`_ model where the source text is maintained under version control, Git in this case. If at any time you are unsure about how to contribute to the documentation do not hesitate to :doc:`ask us questions <contact>`. Documentation as software criteria ---------------------------------- When software is developed certain documentation criteria must be met in order for the software to be considered feature complete. And like software, a documentation contribution must be implemented correctly. This is done by following the below guidelines. Location ~~~~~~~~ The contribution needs to be published in the appropriate location. For a list of all sources of documentation in the OpenStack Charms project see the :doc:`Documentation sources <doc-contrib-sources>` page. Diataxis ~~~~~~~~ The `Diataxis framework`_ is to be implemented throughout the documentation. Please become familiar with it. .. note:: Charmed OpenStack documentation prefers the term "Concepts" in the place of "Explanations". Further reading: * `Diátaxis, a new foundation for Canonical documentation`_ - Ubuntu blog * a `conference talk`_ - PyCon Australia 2017 Writing style ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ In order to maintain a consistent style of writing across all Charmed OpenStack documentation, a style guide is available and must be followed. .. REPLACE THE ABOVE LINE WITH THIS ONCE THE CITED DOCUMENT IS MERGED In order to maintain a consistent style of writing across all Charmed OpenStack documentation, a :doc:`style guide <doc-style-guide>` is available and must be followed. Technical accuracy ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The contribution needs to be technically correct. Additionally, if the content is a howto or a tutorial then it must be tested and verified. Factorisation ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The contribution need not be a monolithic piece of work. On the same topic, there could be several interconnected parts such as a conceptual treatment, a howto guide, and a tutorial. Speak to colleagues, discuss with your local documentarian, or chat on the user forum... _Docs as Code: https://www.writethedocs.org/guide/docs-as-code .. _Diataxis framework: http://diataxis.fr .. _conference talk: https://youtu.be/t4vKPhjcMZg .. _Diátaxis, a new foundation for Canonical documentation: https://ubuntu.com/blog/diataxis-a-new-foundation-for-canonical-documentation
deleted_lines: Documentation for the OpenStack Charms project uses the docs-as-code model where the source text is maintained under version control (Git). The repositories are listed below. If your unsure on how to go about contributing to this documentation don't hesitate to ask questions (see the :doc:`Contact us <contact>` page). * `OpenStack Charm Guide`_ (this guide) * `OpenStack Charms Deployment Guide`_.. _OpenStack Charm Guide: https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide/src/branch/master/README.md .. _OpenStack Charms Deployment Guide: https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-deployment-guide/src/branch/master/README.md

commit_message:
Add n-c-c to HA page

nova-cloud-controller requires a relation to memcached
when it is under HA. A bug is cited that may counter
this practice.

Drive-by: Repair a broken link

Closes-Bug: #1938940
Change-Id: I9ed44f1a0a7121d3cbabad76737f75b5af7773e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/72/833472/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: non-native HA applications. Its sub-sections are not meant to be followed as a guide on how to deploy a cloud. They are a collection of examples only.Keystone provides a classic use case of a non-native HA application. These commands will deploy a three-node Keystone HA cluster, with a VIP of 10.246.114.11. Each node will reside in a container on existing machines 0, 1, and 2:This is sample (partial) output from the :command:`juju status` command resulting from such a deployment:Nova Cloud Controller - hacluster ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Nova Cloud Controller provides a use case of a non-native HA application that requires an extra application in addition to hacluster: memcached. .. note:: Memcached is needed in order for the nova-cloud-controller units to share authentication tokens, but please see `LP #1958674`_ for more clarity. These commands will deploy a three-node Nova Cloud Controller HA cluster: .. code-block:: none juju deploy -n 3 --to lxd:0,lxd:1,lxd:2 --config vip=10.246.114.12 nova-cloud-controller juju deploy --config cluster_count=3 hacluster nova-cloud-controller-hacluster juju add-relation nova-cloud-controller-hacluster:ha nova-cloud-controller:ha The memcached application is then deployed (here containerised on machine 0) and related to nova-cloud-controller: .. code-block:: none juju deploy --to lxd:0 --bind public-space cs:memcached juju add-relation memcached:cache nova-cloud-controller:memcache This is sample (partial) output from the :command:`juju status` command resulting from such a deployment: .. code-block:: console Unit Workload Agent Machine Public address Ports Message memcached/0* active idle 0/lxd/5 10.246.114.57 11211/tcp Unit is ready nova-cloud-controller/0* active idle 0/lxd/3 10.246.114.32 8774/tcp,8775/tcp Unit is ready nova-cloud-controller-hacluster/0* active idle 10.246.114.32 Unit is ready and clustered nova-cloud-controller/1 active idle 1/lxd/5 10.246.114.56 8774/tcp,8775/tcp Unit is ready nova-cloud-controller-hacluster/2 active idle 10.246.114.56 Unit is ready and clustered nova-cloud-controller/2 active idle 2/lxd/6 10.246.114.55 8774/tcp,8775/tcp Unit is ready nova-cloud-controller-hacluster/1 active idle 10.246.114.55 Unit is ready and clustered .. _Managing TLS certificates: https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/charm-deployment-guide/latest/app-certificate-management.html.. _LP #1958674: https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-cloud-controller/+bug/1958674
deleted_lines: non-native HA applications. Keystone will be used to demonstrate how to deploy a non-native HA application using the hacluster subordinate charm. The sub-sections are not meant to be followed as a guide on how to deploy a cloud. They are a collection of examples only.Keystone is not natively HA so the hacluster method is used. Many OpenStack applications are made highly available in this way. In this example the VIP approach is taken. These commands will deploy a three-node Keystone HA cluster, with a VIP of 10.246.114.11. Each will reside in a container on existing machines 0, 1, and 2:Here is sample output from the :command:`juju status` command resulting from such a deployment:.. _Managing TLS certificates: app-certificate-management.html

Fix Dockerfile validation for shell and command

This is a backport of a fix that was included in

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5354e0c007c6f32838b164488cbc3259c505fe3e

commit_message:
containerfile: add support for Docker

In some build environments Docker is already installed - and adding
podman is not an option.  Add a new variable to toggle this, and
rename the now incorrectly titled DIB_CONTAINERFILE_PODMAN_ROOT to
just ...RUNTIME_ROOT to match.

Change-Id: I677e4f491b40360dceabdf4f2a9e64c7cb493dc7

commit_message:
Allow secret delete by users with "creator" role

Users with the "creator" role on a project can now delete secrets owned
by the project even if the user is different than the user that
originally created the secret.  Previous to this fix a user with the
"creator" role was only allowed to delete a secret owned by the project
if they were also the same user that originally created, which was
inconsistent with the way that deletes are handled by other OpenStack
projects that integrate with Barbican.

This change does not affect the policy for delting private secrets
(i.e. secrets with the "project-access" flag set to "false").

Story: 2009791
Task: 44328
Change-Id: Ie3e3adc1ee02d770de050f5cfa8110774bb1f661
(cherry picked from commit 2620d14c5fae378a5e8d7d550d5ae8efb263d63a)
(cherry picked from commit 811a846a508a9e6d2a2e309bf7f6895ae9b6db03)
(cherry picked from commit 0b4532125a6ab133fd547cb38c76487a492f2127)
(cherry picked from commit bdb53f47621c0eb4b49b28e976041781bca6b1ff)

commit_message:
sharding: Add rows_cleaved to CleaveContext

This patch adds a rows_cleaved member variable to the CleaveContexts
that tracks how many object rows were cleaved.

This will allow us to to make better shrinking decisions as we can tell
if a completed context was from a small container or whatnot.

Change-Id: Iab41cdf086c47a0df9fe4721529ca696a82861f0

commit_message:
Add support for PowerMax driver

Dell EMC VMax was rebranded to PowerMax and the related driver and
its parameters were renamed[1]. This change introduces a new resource
type to follow that rebranding.
The existing implementation to use old parameters will be deprecated
and removed in a separate change.

[1] 6995b9f9758f4b8526011954670da5602acb60cb
Partial-bug: #1951131
Change-Id: Ifde59b58915dd00ec8edf136f4bb4a48d8446025
(cherry picked from commit 2e56767d7a9d8bd500bdbc094d4e22c2d5b71c12)
(cherry picked from commit 636043245f315f387f62558e212e43033dcf1438)
(cherry picked from commit 5ad631af09dfd8baaed77fbfdda6a43469010b2f)

added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'manila::backend::dellemc_powermax' do let(:title) {'dellemc_powermax'} let :required_params do { :emc_nas_login => 'admin', :emc_nas_password => 'password', :emc_nas_server => '127.0.0.2', } end let :default_params do { :emc_share_backend => 'powermax', :powermax_server_container => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>', :powermax_share_data_pools => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>', :powermax_ethernet_ports => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>', :backend_availability_zone => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>', } end shared_examples_for 'dell emc powermax share driver' do let :params_hash do default_params.merge(params) end it 'configures dell emc powermax share driver' do is_expected.to contain_manila_config("dellemc_powermax/share_driver").with_value( 'manila.share.drivers.dell_emc.driver.EMCShareDriver') is_expected.to contain_manila_config("dellemc_powermax/driver_handles_share_servers").with_value(true) params_hash.each_pair do |config,value| is_expected.to contain_manila_config("dellemc_powermax/#{config}").with_value( value ) end end it 'marks emc_nas_password as secret' do is_expected.to contain_manila_config("dellemc_powermax/emc_nas_password").with_secret( true ) end end shared_examples 'manila::backend::dellemc_powermax' do context 'with default parameters' do let :params do required_params end it_configures 'dell emc powermax share driver' end context 'with provided parameters' do let :params do required_params.merge!({ :powermax_server_container => 'container1', :powermax_share_data_pools => '*', :powermax_ethernet_ports => 'eth1', :backend_availability_zone => 'my_zone', }) end it_configures 'dell emc powermax share driver' end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge!(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end it_behaves_like 'manila::backend::dellemc_powermax' end end end

commit_message:
Update master for stable/yoga

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/yoga.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/yoga.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I24bff76e6d727260446c6f8ff9709f409e2fae78

pyroute 0.6.7 introduced a new exception NetlinkDumpInterrupted which

Final solution for it should be to use retry as suggested by pyroute2
developers (see [1]), a possible patch for the retry logic is [2].

[1]: https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/issues/874#issuecomment-1063139555
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/833015

Change-Id: I757a2d03e60772c716ddaa5fa63f36cce10af984

commit_message:
Limit pyroute2 to be <0.6.6

pyroute 0.6.7 introduced a new exception NetlinkDumpInterrupted which
is raised when NLM_F_DUMP_INTR is set in the flags during dump of
devices.
Final solution for it should be to use retry as suggested by pyroute2
developers (see [1]), a possible patch for the retry logic is [2].

[1]: https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/issues/874#issuecomment-1063139555
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/833015
Related-Bug: #1962608

Change-Id: I757a2d03e60772c716ddaa5fa63f36cce10af984

commit_message:
Remove else/elif when not needed

The else/elif statements are not strictly needed if the preceding if ends
with return or raise.

Also create set_md_device helper function for uefi boot mode case in
softraid workflow.

Change-Id: I1f804cb8aca008a0359027a766954581987dc1b3

commit_message:
Fix assertion after stack deletion

After a stack has been removed with module stack, a call to module
stack_info might still return this stack with its status set to
'DELETE_COMPLETE' and its status_reason defined as 'Stack DELETE
completed successfully'.

Change-Id: Ice843c403669b4a4e1b12ec73db1fb00d1405980

commit_message:
Simple schema validation mechanism

Adds mechanism for verification of the VF playbooks.
Compares required keys in the parsed YAML and their types
with pre-set validation playbook schema.

Prevents loading of invalid validations at run time and provides
supplementary information about the issues in logs.

Tests for new code are included.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I61ced540dd58e153ac36037cfa8c1743cb38c44f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/validations-libs refs/changes/71/796271/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import yaml def _load_playbook(playbook_path): with open(playbook_path, 'r') as p_file: playbook = yaml.safe_load(p_file.read()) return playbook def verify_playbook_schema(playbook, schema=constants.VALIDATION_PLAYBOOK_SCHEMA): """ """ if type(playbook) == os.PathLike: playbook = _load_playbook(playbook) if len(playbook) != len(schema): raise ValueError() for key in playbook: if key not in schema: raise KeyError() if type(playbook[key]) != schema[key]: raise TypeError() if type(playbook[key]) is dict: return verify_playbook_schema(playbook[key], schema[key]) return True

subject: More fixes for anaconda deploy interface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-07 14:38:22.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/anaconda-deploy-more-fixes-58d996c7031c8c4b.yaml', 'ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_pxe.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ks.cfg.template', 'ironic/common/pxe_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/ea72c95a54da59c8383fd8f0eb5569d17f8a6cd2', 'message': "More fixes for anaconda deploy interface

The anaconda deploy interface has a few issues that are
addressed here:

- fixes logic in get_instance_image_info() for anaconda. If the
  ironic node's instance_info doesn't have both 'stage2' and
  'ks_template' specified, we weren't using any values from the
  instance_info. This has been fixed to use values from
  instance_info if specified. Otherwise, they are set as follows:
  The 'stage2' value is taken from the image properties.
  We use the value for 'ks_template' if it is specified in the
  image properties. If not (since it is optional), we use the
  config option's '[anaconda]default_ks_template' value.
  setting.
- For anaconda's stage2 directory, we were incorrectly creating a
  directory using the full path of the stage2 file. It now
  correctly creates the right directory.
- The anaconda deploy interface expects the node's instance_info
  to be populated with the 'image_url'; added code to do that in
  PXEAnacondaDeploy's prepare() method.
- When the deploy is finished and the bm node is being rebooted,
  we incorrectly set the node's provision state to 'active'
  instead of doing it via the provisioning state machine mechanism.
- The code that was doing the validation of the kickstart file was
  incorrect and resulted in errors; this has been addressed.
- The '%traceback' section in the packaged 'ks.cfg.template' file
  is deprecated and fails validation, so it has been removed.

Change-Id: I953e948bcfa108d4c8e7b145da2f52b652e52a10
(cherry picked from commit 06cc5d47dcdc49193e5e4e748471eb0b9ae97bbb)
"}]
commit_message:
More fixes for anaconda deploy interface

The anaconda deploy interface has a few issues that are
addressed here:

- fixes logic in get_instance_image_info() for anaconda. If the
  ironic node's instance_info doesn't have both 'stage2' and
  'ks_template' specified, we weren't using any values from the
  instance_info. This has been fixed to use values from
  instance_info if specified. Otherwise, they are set as follows:
  The 'stage2' value is taken from the image properties.
  We use the value for 'ks_template' if it is specified in the
  image properties. If not (since it is optional), we use the
  config option's '[anaconda]default_ks_template' value.
  setting.
- For anaconda's stage2 directory, we were incorrectly creating a
  directory using the full path of the stage2 file. It now
  correctly creates the right directory.
- The anaconda deploy interface expects the node's instance_info
  to be populated with the 'image_url'; added code to do that in
  PXEAnacondaDeploy's prepare() method.
- When the deploy is finished and the bm node is being rebooted,
  we incorrectly set the node's provision state to 'active'
  instead of doing it via the provisioning state machine mechanism.
- The code that was doing the validation of the kickstart file was
  incorrect and resulted in errors; this has been addressed.
- The '%traceback' section in the packaged 'ks.cfg.template' file
  is deprecated and fails validation, so it has been removed.

Change-Id: I953e948bcfa108d4c8e7b145da2f52b652e52a10

commit_message:
Remove rhel specific packages for ironic-conductor

The ovirt driver which requires python-ovirt-engine-sdk4 is one of
the staging drivers, and it has been explicitly unsupported for a few
releases now, so it is removed in this change.

The python3dist\(ansible\) package is the old way of installing
ansible, and enables the ansible deploy driver. However this
driver has never been considered supported, so rather than correct the
package name, it is removed in this change.

Change-Id: I415e701b9fdd533299b343891cef920290f4d7a6
(cherry picked from commit 60b48b2eb7d487f3b8cbdbfd91a4046911414803)

commit_message:
replacing controller nodes playbook

This is a basic playbook to automate the process of replacing controller nodes.

It stops the pacemaker on the old node, deletes the old node from pacemaker cluster,
removes node from list of known hosts in pacemaker, ensures pacemaker does not stop
Galera during replacement, determines heat resource ID, creates an enviroment file,
sets node to maintenance mode, and runs overcloud deploy.

Change-Id: I4b729255c7684f6f365e7c470f21c345cae467f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-operator-ansible refs/changes/46/771446/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- ############################################################################### # Replacing Controller Nodes Playbook # # Description: # This is a basic playbook to automate the process of replacing controller # nodes. # ############################################################################### - hosts: undercloud collections: - tripleo.operator vars: bootstrapnode: overcloud-controller-0 oldnode: overcloud-controller-1 node_debug: true node_introspect: true node_environment_source_json_file: /home/stack/templates/remove-controller.yaml deploy_debug: true deploy_templates: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/ deploy_controller_count: 3 deploy_compute_count: 3 deploy_dns: - 1.1.1.1 - 8.8.8.8 deploy_ntp: - 0.pool.ntp.org - 1.pool.ntp.org - 2.pool.ntp.org - 3.pool.ntp.org deploy_env_files: - /home/stack/templates/remove-controller.yaml - "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/remove-controller.yaml" tasks: - os_server_info: cloud: undercloud server: "{{ oldnode }}" register: oldnode_info - name: Stop Pacemaker on oldnode command: "sudo pcs cluster stop {{ oldnode }}" delegate_to: "{{ bootstrapnode }}" - name: Delete the old node from the pacemaker cluster command: "sudo pcs cluster node remove {{ oldnode }}" delegate_to: "{{ bootstrapnode }}" - name: remove node from list of known hosts in pacemaker command: "sudo pcs host deauth {{ oldnode }}" delegate_to: "{{ bootstrapnode }}" - name: ensure Pacemaker does not stop Galera during replacement procedure command: "sudo pcs resource unmanage galera-bundle" delegate_to: "{{ bootstrapnode }}" - name: Determine the heat resource ID of the node to remove shell: | source ~/stackrc openstack stack resource show overcloud ControllerServers -f json -c attributes | jq -c '.attributes.value | keys[] as $k | if .[$k] == "{{ oldnode_info.openstack_servers[0].id }}" then $k else empty end' register: oldnode_index - name: Create Environment file copy: content: | parameter_defaults: ControllerRemovalPolicies: [{'resource_list': [{{ oldnode_index.stdout }}] }] dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/remove-controller.yaml" mode: '0644' - name: Set the node to maintenance mode shell: | source ~/stackrc INSTANCE=$(openstack server list --name {{ oldnode }} -f value -c ID) NODE=$(openstack baremetal node list -f csv --quote minimal | grep $INSTANCE | cut -f1 -d,) openstack baremetal node maintenance set $NODE - name: Run overcloud deployment include_role: name: tripleo_overcloud_deploy vars: tripleo_overcloud_deploy_debug: "{{ deploy_debug }}" tripleo_overcloud_deploy_environment_files: "{{ deploy_env_files }}" tripleo_overcloud_deploy_templates: "{{ deploy_templates }}"

commit_message:
Add Yoga release cycle priorities

Change-Id: Ic2d15caaf2d0e83b412f8f50bf2d0c01cab3d8c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-specs refs/changes/21/833621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _yoga-priorities: =========================== Yoga Project Priorities =========================== List of priorities the Monasca drivers team is prioritizing in Yoga. The owners listed are responsible for tracking the status of that work and helping get that work done. They are not the only contributors to this work, and not necessarily doing most of the coding! The implementation progress on these priorities and other identified important tasks is tracked in `this board`_. .. _this board: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/board/247 Essential Priorities ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ +----------------------------------------------------+---------------------------+ | Title | Owners | +====================================================+===========================+ | `Update Docker Images` | chaconpiza | +----------------------------------------------------+---------------------------+ | `Update https://github.com/monasca/monasca-docker` | chaconpiza | +----------------------------------------------------+---------------------------+ | `Bring compatibility with Python3 zed unit tests` | chaconpiza | +----------------------------------------------------+---------------------------+ High Priorities ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ +----------------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ | Title | Owners | +====================================================+=========================+ | `Thresholding engine in cluster mode` | chaconpiza | +----------------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ | `Add Time and Times in Monasca UI` | | +----------------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ | `Define Prometheus based architecture` | | +----------------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ | `Application Credentials`_ | | +----------------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ | `Middleware upgrades ELK 7.3.0 -> OpenDistro` | | +----------------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ Optional Priorities ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ +------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ | Title | Owners | +==========================================+=========================+ +------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ | `Selenium Tests for Monasca-UI` | | +------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ | `OpenStack Client Integration` | | +------------------------------------------+-------------------------+ Details ~~~~~~~ Application Credentials ----------------------- `Keystone appliction credentials <https://docs.openstack .org/keystone/latest/user/application_credentials.html>`_ offer the mechanism to allow applications to authenticate to Keystone. The ability to specify `access rules <http://specs.openstack .org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/stein/capabilities-app-creds .html>`_ for application credentials has been implemented in the Train cycle. The goal of this story is to add application credentials support in *monasca-agent*. This will prevent the security risk of revealing OpenStack user's password when installing the agent on the tenants environment. The access rules of these application credentials should be limited to posting measurements. *monasca-setup* should be extended to automatically generate such credentials and save them in configuration file if needed. Similar task should be implemented in *monasca-grafana-datasource*. Stories: * https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005622 * https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005623

commit_message:
Fix assertion after stack deletion

After a stack has been removed with module stack, a call to module
stack_info might still return this stack with its status set to
'DELETE_COMPLETE' and its status_reason defined as 'Stack DELETE
completed successfully'.

Change-Id: Ice843c403669b4a4e1b12ec73db1fb00d1405980

commit_message:
Update master for stable/yoga

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/yoga.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/yoga.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I29820d1f908f6bb90e2c78b6c52b429b24abf378

commit_message:
Introduce a logline iteartor to process the build file in constant memory

This change avoids loading the whole file in memory.

Change-Id: I22b85872f1f7a288802b8b44b753c3faf8316401
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ci-log-processing refs/changes/66/831966/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def logline_iter(build_file): last_known_timestamp = None with open(file_path, 'r') as f: while True: line = f.readline() if line: ts = get_timestamp(line) if ts: last_known_timestamp = ts else: ts = last_known_timestamp yield (ts, line) else: break for (ts, line) in logline_iter(build_file): fields["@timestamp"] = ts
deleted_lines: file_content = read_text_file(build_file) for line in file_content: fields["@timestamp"] = get_timestamp(line)

@mock.patch('logscraper.logsender.logline_iter_chunk') @mock.patch('logscraper.logsender.logline_iter') def test_send_to_es(self, mock_args, mock_text, mock_bulk, mock_logline, mock_logline_chunk): mock_logline_chunk.return_value = es_doc self.assertEqual(3, mock_bulk.call_count) mock_bulk.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(es_client, es_doc[0], 1, False, 1000), mock.call(es_client, es_doc[1], 1, False, 1000), mock.call(es_client, es_doc[2], 1, False, 1000) ], any_order=True) @mock.patch('logscraper.logsender.logline_iter') def test_logline_iter_chunk(self, mock_logline): text = [('2022-02-28T09:39:09.596000', '2022-02-28 09:39:09.596010 | Job console starting...
'), ('2022-02-28T09:39:09.610000', '2022-02-28 09:39:09.610160 | Updating repositories
')] expected_chunk = [[{ '_index': 'someindex', '_type': '_doc', '_source': { 'field': 'test', '@timestamp': '2022-02-28T09:39:09.596000', 'message': ' Job console starting...' } }, { '_index': 'someindex', '_type': '_doc', '_source': { 'field': 'test', '@timestamp': '2022-02-28T09:39:09.610000', 'message': ' Updating repositories' } }]] chunk_text = list( logsender.logline_iter_chunk(text, 'someindex', {'field': 'test'}, '_doc', 1000)) self.assertEqual(expected_chunk, chunk_text) def test_logline_iter(self): text = """2022-02-28 09:39:09.596010 | Job console starting... 2022-02-28 09:39:09.610160 | Updating repositories 2022-02-28 09:39:09.996235 | Preparing job workspace""" expected_data = [ ('2022-02-28T09:39:09.596000', '2022-02-28 09:39:09.596010 | Job console starting...
'), ('2022-02-28T09:39:09.610000', '2022-02-28 09:39:09.610160 | Updating repositories
'), ('2022-02-28T09:39:09.996000', '2022-02-28 09:39:09.996235 | Preparing job workspace') ] readed_data = mock.mock_open(read_data=text) with mock.patch('builtins.open', readed_data) as mocked_open_file: generated_text = list(logsender.logline_iter('nofile')) self.assertEqual(expected_data, generated_text) self.assertTrue(mocked_open_file.called)
deleted_lines: def test_send_to_es(self, mock_args, mock_text, mock_bulk): mock_bulk.assert_called_once_with(es_client, es_doc, 1, False, 1000)

commit_message:
Handle composed role name not strictly matching deployed server name

The tripleo-ansible ceph_spec_bootstrap module it's now able to match a
provided Controller/Compute/Ceph role with the corresponding hosts
within the generated roles_data.

Closes-Bug: #1962588
Change-Id: I46e547c52f5e2f28e25db96ad41283585c409bf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/23/831523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'fixed_ip in the data file: {metalsmith_data_file}' .format(metalsmith_data_file=metalsmith_data_file))def normalize_composable_roles(role): ''' If a composable role is used, the name which is found on the metalsmith produced file can be different from the 'HostnameFormat' of roles_data. Given a composable role as input like the following: "ControllerStorageNFS" -> ["Controller", "Storage", "NFS"] "ComputeHCI" -> ["Compute", "HCI"] "CephStorage" -> ["Ceph", "Storage"] "Controller" -> ["Controller"] "Compute" -> ["Compute"] ''' return re.sub('([A-Z][a-z]+)', r' \1', re.sub('([A-Z]+)', r' \1', role)).split()[0] # for each role passed as input (e.g. ControllerStorageNFS, # ComputeHCI, CephStorage) we need to iterate over the metal # generated file and get the corresponding host from HostnameMap for role in roles: roles_to_hosts[role] = [] # Build a regex based on the role rfmt = re.compile('^' + normalize_composable_roles(role) + '.*(.*)HostnameFormat') # noqa E501 for item in metal['parameter_defaults']: if rfmt.match(item): # Get the right hostname that matches the # normalized pattern for the current role h_fmt = metal['parameter_defaults'][item] pat = h_fmt.replace('%stackname%', '.*').replace('-%index%', '') roles_to_hosts[role].append(name_map[host]) 'not defined in data file: {metalsmith_data_file}' .format(metalsmith_data_file=metalsmith_data_file)) roles_to_services[role].append(inverse_service_map[key_rename]) # noqa E501 roles_to_services = dict() roles_to_services[role['name']] = [] roles_to_services[role['name']].append(svc_short)def get_label_map(hosts_to_ips, roles_to_svcs, roles_to_hosts, ceph_service_types): """Return a map of hostname to list of ceph service to run on that host, e.g. label_map['oc0-ceph-0'] = ['osd'] label_map['oc0-controller-0'] = ['mon', 'mgr', '_admin'] spec = ceph_spec.CephHostSpec('host', ip, host, label_map[host], location=cr.get(host, None)) error = "The fqdn option may only be true when using tripleo_ansible_inventory" # noqa E501 specs = get_specs(hosts_to_ips, label_map, ceph_service_types, osd_spec, crush)

commit_message:
Carry an upper constraint file to unblock the gate

This change introduces a new file to limit our lint jobs constraints.
This is added so that we can unblock the gates while we want for a fix
to land in either setuptools or in global requirements.

Related-bug: 1962232
Change-Id: I5f73ef45f2a84145a190764fcf09ea3011154d10
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

Added a sample VNF package for practical use cases.

In this sample, the use cases listed below is supported.
  - using multiple deployment flavours
  - deploying VNF connected to an external network
  - deploying VNF as HA cluster
  - deploying scalable VNF
  - configuring VNF with an Ansible Mgmt Driver

commit_message:
Add a VNF package sample for practical use cases

Added a sample VNF package for practical use cases.

In this sample, the use cases listed below is supported.
  - using multiple deployment flavours
  - deploying VNF connected to an external network
  - deploying VNF as HA cluster
  - deploying scalable VNF

Implements: blueprint add-vnf-package-sample-for-practical-use-cases
Spec: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker-specs/+/814511
Change-Id: I1c55e028b96ba3c1ad26270d359e0b1165670078

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I69f40ce666e3ff390b1d4fa49ca625e13fb8fd53

commit_message:
fix strutils password regex

Those regexes will fix Object style representation output.
See the payload used in tests for details. This kind
of output can be obtained by using the command:

```
$ openstack --debug
```

commit_message:
Build the new cirros image even when netboot is the default

The standalone job changes boot_option in runtime, so local boot
can be used even when the default boot option is netboot.

Change-Id: Ia538907f3662e8cd84d988ea5d862c7f488558e1
(cherry picked from commit 7ac480412626c38fa3493088dbf49e29303491b6)

commit_message:
Change local_action to delegate_to: localhost

As part of the effort to implement Ansible code linting in CI
(using ansible-lint) - we need to implement recommendations from
ansible-lint output [1].

One of them is to stop using local_action in favor of delegate_to -
to increase readability and and match the style of typical ansible
tasks.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/694779/

Partially implements: blueprint ansible-lint

Change-Id: I46c259ddad5a6aaf9c7301e6c44cd8a1d5c457d3
(cherry picked from commit 1009931162aced2daa78ec9943bbad2530360f8d)

subject: [OVN] Update VIP port host ID when traffic detected
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-02-23 14:46:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/cb9d3fdefe593e450d71df6666cd6530b79bf074', 'message': '[WIP] [OVN] Update VIP port host ID when traffic detected

TODO: testing!
      documentation

A virtual IP port is a port with an IP address assigned. This IP
address is used as an allowed address pair in a bound port (or ports).
This port is marked as "virtual" and a list of "virtual-parents"
(ports with the VIP assigned as allowed address pair) will be
populated accordingly.

This patch updates the "binding:host_id" of the port when OVN detects
traffic from the corresponding VIP address. OVN updates the VIP port
SB "Port_Binding" register with the chassis ID. The hostname of this
chassis is used to update the port host ID.

The VIP port is always unbound and down; this patch only populates the
host information to provide to the user this information using the
OpenStack CLI, instead of making this search using the OVN CLI.

Closes-Bug: #1961184
Change-Id: I75b04d056ba0df9e34a99673c689a69cdbfa097e

commit_message:
[OVN] Update VIP port host ID when traffic detected

A virtual IP port is a port with an IP address assigned. This IP
address is used as an allowed address pair in a bound port (or ports).
This port is marked as "virtual" and a list of "virtual-parents"
(ports with the VIP assigned as allowed address pair) will be
populated accordingly.

This patch updates the "binding:host_id" of the port when OVN detects
traffic from the corresponding VIP address. OVN updates the VIP port
SB "Port_Binding" register with the chassis ID. The hostname of this
chassis is used to update the port host ID.

The VIP port is always unbound and down; this patch only populates the
host information to provide to the user this information using the
OpenStack CLI, instead of making this search using the OVN CLI.

Closes-Bug: #1961184
Change-Id: I75b04d056ba0df9e34a99673c689a69cdbfa097e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/24/830624/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def bind_virtual_port(self, port_id, chassis_id): if chassis_id: hostname = self.sb_ovn.db_get( 'Chassis', chassis_id, 'hostname').execute(check_error=True) else: hostname = '' self._plugin.update_vip_port_binding(n_context.get_admin_context(), port_id, hostname)

Update master for stable/yoga

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/yoga.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/yoga.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Ic7c275b38fef9afc29577f81fe92546bb94b2930

commit_message:
Disable GSSAPIAuthentication by default

Having GSSAPIAuthentication enabled by default
can cause issues during the deployment process
if the user is unable to authenticate with kerberos.

This change moves the default for GSSAPIAuthentication
to no instead of yes.

Resolves: rhbz#2059855
Change-Id: Ic579380c9c72917daa01493c259bc969b7291fe9
(cherry picked from commit fa69bfc1eb6deadd6b05d839f4ad1c2c86107931)

subject: Deprecate usage of authtoken parameters in providers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-02-21 15:14:14.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/sahara.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/provider-deprecate-at-params-8b0a649a3b201804.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-sahara/commit/67d927581e6bace11b644a059a445aef8d3a7717', 'message': 'Deprecate usage of authtoken parameters in providers

When SRBAC is completely implemented according to the current spec,
each service user no longer has full admin privilege but has access
limited to the actual requirement. This means that we are no longer
able to use service users to create resources.

This change is a prep-work to get rid of usage of the service user,
currently loaded from authtoken parameters in the .conf file. Now
each providers loads clouds.yaml file placed in /etc/openstack/puppet.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/806474
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/828025
Change-Id: I42e24b712d6abb78483bb470a1966e23b97e0d0c
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate usage of authtoken parameters in providers

When SRBAC is completely implemented according to the current spec,
each service user no longer has full admin privilege but has access
limited to the actual requirement. This means that we are no longer
able to use service users to create resources.

This change is a prep-work to get rid of usage of the service user,
currently loaded from authtoken parameters in the .conf file. Now
each providers loads clouds.yaml file placed in /etc/openstack/puppet.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/806474
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/828025
Change-Id: I42e24b712d6abb78483bb470a1966e23b97e0d0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-sahara refs/changes/12/830212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - | The following resource types have been using the credential written in the ``[keystone_authtoken]`` section of ``sahara.conf``. However this behavior has been deprecated and now these resource types first look for the yaml files in ``/etc/openstack/puppet``. Make sure one of ``clouds.yaml`` or ``admin-clouds.yaml`` (which is created by puppet-keystone) is created in that directory. - ``sahara_cluster_template`` - ``sahara_node_group_template``

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibac36ae61cc94d3abae3df881e9adcc8fae1dac1

commit_message:
Make --osd-spec and --crush-hierarchy not mutually exclusive

Allow 'openstack overcloud ceph deploy' to take both the
--osd-spec and --crush-hierarchy arguments by removing
--crush-hierarchy from the mutually exclusive spec_group
and adding it to the regular parser.

Also, do not use mutually exclusive spec_group for 'openstack
overcloud ceph spec' since the --ceph-spec optsion is never
passed to 'openstack overcloud ceph spec'.

Conflict tripleoclient/v2/overcloud_ceph.py
OvercloudCephSpec class is not in wallaby so only OvercloudCephDeploy
class was modified.

Closes-Bug: 1964033
Change-Id: I88ed9e4f65ba0adfefd5e84111e4f787f77c5b97
(cherry picked from commit 88864174e801cb2dc5df7ac9b74df033a1efab6f)

subject: Release Yoga RC1 for cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-07 22:40:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/2b98e59722cfe05a8cf9713bc59bcca5ac720a76', 'message': 'Release Yoga RC1 for cinder

This patch proposes an RC1 release for cinder to get any merged
changes out prior to the RC1 deadline for Yoga going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, March 10th.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I6543949d5c6636b316330e5b7e17be5708bca174

commit_message:
Add job separation for the new tests

This change adds a new playbook to exercise new SDK compabilt modules.
At this time the new playbook is empty and the test has been made
voding, in a follow-on review the role inclusions will be filled out to
ensure we're covering and showing valid test results for all converted
modules supported by this collection.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idd112760174df40d22275fe5336799763716e344

commit_message:
Add socket keepalive options for the pymemcache backend

This patch specifies a set of options required to setup the socket
keepalive feature of pymemcache (dogpile.cache) cache backend.

Original oslo.cache change:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.cache/+/803716

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/807851
Change-Id: I195d3984248d8402953843bd49bd5e0838bf4fde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/24/816624/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*enable_socket_keepalive*] # (Optional) Global toggle for the socket keepalive of dogpile's # pymemcache backend # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*socket_keepalive_idle*] # (Optional) The time (in seconds) the connection needs to remain # idle before TCP starts sending keepalive probes. Should # be a positive integer most greater than zero. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*socket_keepalive_intvl*] # (Optional) The time (in seconds) between individual keepalive # probes. Should be a positive integer most greater # than zero. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*socket_keepalive_cnt*] # (Optional) The maximum number of keepalive probes TCP should # send before dropping the connection. Should be a # positive integer most greater than zero. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $enable_socket_keepalive = $::os_service_default, $socket_keepalive_idle = $::os_service_default, $socket_keepalive_intvl = $::os_service_default, $socket_keepalive_cnt = $::os_service_default, enable_socket_keepalive => $enable_socket_keepalive, socket_keepalive_idle => $socket_keepalive_idle, socket_keepalive_intvl => $socket_keepalive_intvl, socket_keepalive_cnt => $socket_keepalive_cnt,

commit_message:
FT of multi tenants for CNF

This patch adds functional test cases to validate instantiate CNF
functionality in a multi-tenant environment.
Validates CNF instantiation is only allowed when CNF and VIM
belongs to same tenant.

Implements: blueprint k8s-namespace
Change-Id: I800b497ea6fa8f4978eb551558f0257e3d82a4ee

subject: Use utf-16-le if BOM not present
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-03 06:25:29.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/efi_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/detect-endianness-f53a6c4571aba3fe.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/45fa718c7e586536ac1dc47a425244f034819f5d', 'message': "Use utf-16-le if BOM not present

In case no BOM is present in the CSV file the utf-16 codec won't work.
We fail over to utf-16-le as Little Endian is commonly used.

Change-Id: I3e25ce4997f5dd3df87caba753daced65838f85a
(cherry picked from commit 697fa6f3b6db10408eaadd57450456de87f13519)
"}]
commit_message:
Use utf-16-le if BOM not present

In case no BOM is present in the CSV file the utf-16 codec won't work.
We fail over to utf-16-le as Little Endian is commonly used.

Change-Id: I3e25ce4997f5dd3df87caba753daced65838f85a
(cherry picked from commit 697fa6f3b6db10408eaadd57450456de87f13519)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/83/831583/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | In case the CSV file used for the bootloader hint does not have BOM we fail reading its content as utf-16 codec is too generic. Fail over to utf-16-le as Little Endian is mostly used.

commit_message:
Add all jobs from the periodic queue to experimental one

It may help with e.g. debugging periodic jobs as in experimental
queue they can be triggered manually on any specific patch.
It also will not hurt us too much as experimental pipeline isn't
run automatically anywhere.

Change-Id: If4b8f6bb8195ae6e7db1be5ec88d83bf131adf3b

commit_message:
fix: Fix the log_dir

If the log_dir is /var/log/kolla, and when we
deploy with devstack, we only chown the permission
for /var/log/kolla/skyline with stack user.
But the permission for /var/log/kolla is still root.
So it can not be access by stack user.
We will both change the log_dir in skyline-console
project.

commit_message:
Add documents for enhance operations in V2

This patch provides Tacker documents for enhance operations(heal,
scale, update, changeextconn) in V2-API. The specification about new
API is added to API Reference. Also, update operation is added to
Tacker Use Cases Guide and CLI Reference.

This patch also includes changes to the user data script.

Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-change-external-connectivity
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-heal-vnf
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-modify-vnf
Implements: blueprint support-nfv-solv3-scale-vnf
Change-Id: I6adefc59903a4c8305a66c224c086af4b86812df

commit_message:
Remove questionable defaults from the network configuration

We definitely should not default to using Google DNS or assuming a
specific MTU. The default gateway won't work for many deployments.

Remove them, refactor network_metadata and add some unit tests.

Change-Id: Icb5d077a5f68b5affc1ed545e04c96dcc01d9f3e

commit_message:
Fix permissions on ganesha related tasks

This patch just adds 'become: true' in several ganesha related tasks.
The fixed tasks are supposed to create and distribute config files (and
make operations on that portion of the fs now owned by the stack user),
 hence we need to fix a few permissions issues.

Closes-Bug: #1963285
Change-Id: Ia5a763be5710c9083cfae30b8fd3f698c65846a1
(cherry picked from commit fefd39a26ce02c500f9bad368c59917757453480)

commit_message:
Cast tripleo_cephadm_container_tag to string

The cephadm container image tag is usually alphanumeric (e.g. it can
be found in the form of <major>-<minor> or something like that).
For this reason we need jinja to produce the right string that should
be passed to the --image option and avoid an unexpected templating
error where the tripleo_cephadm_container_tag must be str and not int.

Change-Id: Ibaf94f72d3532ebac580cca96f71ad8d25ff2eff
(cherry picked from commit 8bab831a8a1c543adc1cc99d2a28135590ac0551)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/63/831863/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

In Kolla Ansible OpenStack deployments, by default, libvirt is
configured to allow read-write access via an unauthenticated,
unencrypted TCP connection, using the internal API network.  This is to
facilitate migration between hosts.

By default, Kolla Ansible does not use encryption for services on the
internal network (and did not support it until Ussuri). However, most
other services on the internal network are at least authenticated
(usually via passwords), ensuring that they cannot be used by anyone
with access to the network, unless they have credentials.

The main issue here is the lack of authentication. Any client with
access to the internal network is able to connect to the libvirt TCP
port and make arbitrary changes to the hypervisor. This could include
starting a VM, modifying an existing VM, etc. Given the flexibility of
the domain options, it could be seen as equivalent to having root access
to the hypervisor.

Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS [1] since the Train release, using
client and server certificates for mutual authentication and encryption.
However, this feature is not enabled by default, and requires
certificates to be generated for each compute host.

This change adds support for libvirt SASL authentication, and enables it
by default. This provides base level of security. Deployments requiring
further security should use libvirt TLS.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/compute/libvirt-guide.html#libvirt-tls

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/833021

Change-Id: Ia91ceeb609e4cdb144433122b443028c0278b71e
(cherry picked from commit d2d4b53d47df3b1a250c21404a8ec140873d4ce5)

commit_message:
libvirt: support SASL authentication

In Kolla Ansible OpenStack deployments, by default, libvirt is
configured to allow read-write access via an unauthenticated,
unencrypted TCP connection, using the internal API network.  This is to
facilitate migration between hosts.

By default, Kolla Ansible does not use encryption for services on the
internal network (and did not support it until Ussuri). However, most
other services on the internal network are at least authenticated
(usually via passwords), ensuring that they cannot be used by anyone
with access to the network, unless they have credentials.

The main issue here is the lack of authentication. Any client with
access to the internal network is able to connect to the libvirt TCP
port and make arbitrary changes to the hypervisor. This could include
starting a VM, modifying an existing VM, etc. Given the flexibility of
the domain options, it could be seen as equivalent to having root access
to the hypervisor.

Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS [1] since the Train release, using
client and server certificates for mutual authentication and encryption.
However, this feature is not enabled by default, and requires
certificates to be generated for each compute host.

This change adds support for libvirt SASL authentication, and enables it
by default. This provides base level of security. Deployments requiring
further security should use libvirt TLS.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/compute/libvirt-guide.html#libvirt-tls

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/833021
Closes-Bug: #1964013
Change-Id: Ia91ceeb609e4cdb144433122b443028c0278b71e
(cherry picked from commit d2d4b53d47df3b1a250c21404a8ec140873d4ce5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/21/833421/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds support for libvirt SASL authentication. It is enabled by default. `LP#1964013 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1964013>`__ security: - | Fixes an issue where the default configuration of libvirt did not use authentication for the API exposed over TCP on the internal API network. This allowed anyone with access to the internal API network read-write access to libvirt. While the internal API network is typically trusted, other services on this network generally at least require authentication. SASL authentication is now enabled for libvirt by default. Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS since the Train release, and this is recommended to provide a higher level of security. `LP#1964013 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1964013>`__ upgrade: - | The addition of libvirt SASL authentication requires a new password in ``passwords.yml``, ``libvirt_sasl_password``. This may be generated using the existing ``kolla-genpwd`` and ``kolla-mergepwd`` tooling. - | The addition of libvirt SASL authentication requires both the ``nova_libvirt`` and ``nova_compute`` containers to be updated simultaneously, using new images with the necessary Cyrus SASL dependencies, as well as configuration containing the SASL credentials.

subject: Do not remount failed drives
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-02 10:39:06.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/storage/mount.pp', 'facts.d/swift_fstab_dev_list.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/80ca0513b6a08cfbed443bdd28268be369b1b7f1', 'message': "Do not remount failed drives

When a drive fails, swift umount it, and comments out the entry in
/etc/fstab. When puppet runs again, it re-adds a *NEW* entry in
fstab and attempts to remount the drive.

With this patch, a fact swift_fstab_dev_list.sh tells if an entry
exists but is commented-out, and if that's the case, then mount.pp
doesn't attempt to mount the disk again.

Change-Id: I5a4b40401790498742cf0cdcee473a78a9f28d2b
"}]
commit_message:
Do not remount failed drives

When a drive fails, swift umount it, and comments out the entry in
/etc/fstab. When puppet runs again, it re-adds a *NEW* entry in
fstab and attempts to remount the drive.

With this patch, a fact swift_fstab_dev_list.sh tells if an entry
exists but is commented-out, and if that's the case, then mount.pp
doesn't attempt to mount the disk again.

Change-Id: I5a4b40401790498742cf0cdcee473a78a9f28d2b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/76/649276/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh # This external fact will set something like this: # puppet_swift_in_fstab_vdb=active # puppet_swift_in_fstab_vdc=commented # the first one is a normal activated fstab line # while the second one represent a line commented-out by swift set -e while read LINE ; do if echo $LINE | grep -q '^[#]*UUID=' ; then MNT_PATH=$(echo $LINE | awk '{print $2}') if echo "${MNT_PATH}" | grep -q '^/srv/node/' ; then DEVNAME=$(echo $MNT_PATH | sed s+^/srv/node/++) if echo $LINE | grep -q '^#' ; then LINESTATE=commented else LINESTATE=active fi echo puppet_swift_in_fstab_$DEVNAME=$LINESTATE fi fi done < /etc/fstab

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-13 20:23:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/4391a29258f272592ca619592fefcc865a399aa3', 'message': 'Mount Swift disk even if not formatted by puppet-swift

commit_message:
Mount Swift disk even if not formatted by puppet-swift

Currently a given Swift disk will only be mounted if it was formatted
first with XFS by puppet-swift. However, if there is an existing XFS FS
it will not be mounted, which might create other issues afterwards.

There are multiple possibilites for an existing XFS filesystem, one
being to use existing Swift disks and the data that is already stored.

This patch only changes the chaining arrow from notifying to ordering,
and therefore always tries to mount the given disk.

Closes-Bug: 1717021
Change-Id: I7693a21b6b32fcaf4dc9efe32cd9f1c38ebffa7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/02/503802/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Mount Swift disk even if not formatted by puppet-swift. Currently a given Swift disk will only be mounted if it was formatted first with XFS by puppet-swift. However, if there is an existing XFS FS it will not be mounted, which might create other issues afterwards. There are multiple possibilites for an existing XFS filesystem, one being to use existing Swift disks and the data that is already stored.

commit_message:
Update VPP ML2 and Agent parameters

The latest release of networking-vpp ML2 drvier/agent requires the
following addtional configs:
- For ML2 driver, we need to configure L3 vpp-routing hosts
- For VPP agent, we need to configure type_drivers and serivce_plugins

Closes-Bug: #1790526

Change-Id: I0a19abcc59e294ee54380c08c552ee1b147c837a
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/50/599450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*l3_hosts*] # (optional) L3 vpp-routing hosts # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # $l3_hosts = $::os_service_default, 'ml2_vpp/l3_hosts': value => $l3_hosts;

commit_message:
Introduce heat::clients class

This patch aims to manage OpenStack services clients
configuration in Heat which including:
 - Aodh
 - Barbican
 - Cinder
 - Glance
 - Magnum
 - Neutron
 - Nova

Change-Id: I07993df9993ad3e69848b915cd659b46322b75cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/99/677299/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == Class: heat::clients # # Manages the clients configuration in heat server # # === Parameters: # # [*endpoint_type*] # (optional) Type of endpoint in Identity service catalog to use for # communication with the OpenStack service. # Defaults to publicURL # # [*ca_file*] # (optional) CA cert file to use in SSL connections. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*cert_file*] # (optional) PEM-formatted certificate chain file. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*key_file*] # (optional) PEM-formatted file that contains the private key. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*insecure*] # (optional) If set, then the server's certificate will not be verified. # Defaults to false # class heat::clients ( $endpoint_type = 'publicURL', $ca_file = $::os_service_default, $cert_file = $::os_service_default, $key_file = $::os_service_default, $insecure = false ) { include ::heat::deps include ::heat::params include ::heat::clients::aodh include ::heat::clients::barbican include ::heat::clients::cinder include ::heat::clients::glance include ::heat::clients::magnum include ::heat::clients::neutron include ::heat::clients::nova }

Add support for the resource_provider_inventory_defaults parameter

This change adds support for the resource_provider_inventory_defaults
parameter, which is used by openvswitch-agent and sriov-agent.

subject: Deprecate usage of authtoken parameters in providers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-02-21 14:58:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/38a4af9f9c01436a105e1677776b9ecf475cab76', 'message': 'Use system scope credentials in providers

This change enforces usage of system scope credentials to manage
flavors, aggregates, and services, following the new policy rules for
SRBAC support in nova.

The logic to look up credential for the nova service user from
[keystone_authtoken] is left to keep backward compatibility but is
deprecated and will be removed.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/806474
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/828025
Change-Id: I55436944a6cdeca7786cd07580d21643094d2d8e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-02-21 14:58:41.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/provider-deprecate-at-params-d688fca46bafe562.yaml', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/46d690052234a3e6a47116f924cb74bc72e0a8ea', 'message': 'Deprecate usage of authtoken parameters in providers

When SRBAC is completely implemented according to the current spec,
each service user no longer has full admin privilege but has access
limited to the actual requirement. This means that we are no longer
able to use service users to create resources.

This change is a prep-work to get rid of usage of the service user,
currently loaded from authtoken parameters in the .conf file. Now
each providers loads clouds.yaml file placed in /etc/openstack/puppet.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/806474
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/828025

commit_message:
Deprecate usage of authtoken parameters in providers

When SRBAC is completely implemented according to the current spec,
each service user no longer has full admin privilege but has access
limited to the actual requirement. This means that we are no longer
able to use service users to create resources.

This change is a prep-work to get rid of usage of the service user,
currently loaded from authtoken parameters in the .conf file. Now
each providers loads clouds.yaml file placed in /etc/openstack/puppet.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/806474
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/828025
Change-Id: I55436944a6cdeca7786cd07580d21643094d2d8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/89/830189/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - | The following resource types have been using the credential written in the ``[keystone_authtoken]`` section of ``neutron.conf``. However this behavior has been deprecated and now these resource types first look for the yaml files in ``/etc/openstack/puppet``. Make sure one of ``clouds.yaml`` or ``admin-clouds.yaml`` (which is created by puppet-keystone) is created in that directory. - ``neutron_network`` - ``neutron_subnet`` - ``neutron_port`` - ``neutron_router`` - ``neutron_router_interface`` - ``neutron_security_group``

commit_message:
Drop support for old libvirt package

This change removes logic to support very old packages. Currently all
distros we support provider puppet 5.6 or later and we don't expect
users are using packages older than distro packages.

Change-Id: I8af9b282e88e479bcc42f7756bf9537fada837be

commit_message:
ceph_spec_bootstrap should not always require a method

Method from I17f4303636b08d2be2d0f6e248242ad53c5fddf1
should not be required input. It was meant only to
disambiguate if >1 methods were used. If only one
method is passed, then ceph_spec_bootstrap should
be able to figure out which method to use.

Related-Bug: 1964524

commit_message:
libvirt: support SASL authentication

In Kolla Ansible OpenStack deployments, by default, libvirt is
configured to allow read-write access via an unauthenticated,
unencrypted TCP connection, using the internal API network.  This is to
facilitate migration between hosts.

By default, Kolla Ansible does not use encryption for services on the
internal network (and did not support it until Ussuri). However, most
other services on the internal network are at least authenticated
(usually via passwords), ensuring that they cannot be used by anyone
with access to the network, unless they have credentials.

The main issue here is the lack of authentication. Any client with
access to the internal network is able to connect to the libvirt TCP
port and make arbitrary changes to the hypervisor. This could include
starting a VM, modifying an existing VM, etc. Given the flexibility of
the domain options, it could be seen as equivalent to having root access
to the hypervisor.

Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS [1] since the Train release, using
client and server certificates for mutual authentication and encryption.
However, this feature is not enabled by default, and requires
certificates to be generated for each compute host.

This change adds support for libvirt SASL authentication, and enables it
by default. This provides base level of security. Deployments requiring
further security should use libvirt TLS.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/compute/libvirt-guide.html#libvirt-tls

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/833021
Closes-Bug: #1964013
Change-Id: Ia91ceeb609e4cdb144433122b443028c0278b71e
(cherry picked from commit d2d4b53d47df3b1a250c21404a8ec140873d4ce5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/24/833424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds support for libvirt SASL authentication. It is enabled by default. `LP#1964013 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1964013>`__ security: - | Fixes an issue where the default configuration of libvirt did not use authentication for the API exposed over TCP on the internal API network. This allowed anyone with access to the internal API network read-write access to libvirt. While the internal API network is typically trusted, other services on this network generally at least require authentication. SASL authentication is now enabled for libvirt by default. Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS since the Train release, and this is recommended to provide a higher level of security. `LP#1964013 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1964013>`__ upgrade: - | The addition of libvirt SASL authentication requires a new password in ``passwords.yml``, ``libvirt_sasl_password``. This may be generated using the existing ``kolla-genpwd`` and ``kolla-mergepwd`` tooling. - | The addition of libvirt SASL authentication requires both the ``nova_libvirt`` and ``nova_compute`` containers to be updated simultaneously, using new images with the necessary Cyrus SASL dependencies, as well as configuration containing the SASL credentials.

commit_message:
libvirt: support SASL authentication

In Kolla Ansible OpenStack deployments, by default, libvirt is
configured to allow read-write access via an unauthenticated,
unencrypted TCP connection, using the internal API network.  This is to
facilitate migration between hosts.

By default, Kolla Ansible does not use encryption for services on the
internal network (and did not support it until Ussuri). However, most
other services on the internal network are at least authenticated
(usually via passwords), ensuring that they cannot be used by anyone
with access to the network, unless they have credentials.

The main issue here is the lack of authentication. Any client with
access to the internal network is able to connect to the libvirt TCP
port and make arbitrary changes to the hypervisor. This could include
starting a VM, modifying an existing VM, etc. Given the flexibility of
the domain options, it could be seen as equivalent to having root access
to the hypervisor.

Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS [1] since the Train release, using
client and server certificates for mutual authentication and encryption.
However, this feature is not enabled by default, and requires
certificates to be generated for each compute host.

This change adds support for libvirt SASL authentication, and enables it
by default. This provides base level of security. Deployments requiring
further security should use libvirt TLS.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/compute/libvirt-guide.html#libvirt-tls

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/833021
Closes-Bug: #1964013
Change-Id: Ia91ceeb609e4cdb144433122b443028c0278b71e
(cherry picked from commit d2d4b53d47df3b1a250c21404a8ec140873d4ce5)

It is enabled by default. `LP#1964013 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1964013>`__ security: - | Fixes an issue where the default configuration of libvirt did not use authentication for the API exposed over TCP on the internal API network. This allowed anyone with access to the internal API network read-write access to libvirt. While the internal API network is typically trusted, other services on this network generally at least require authentication. SASL authentication is now enabled for libvirt by default. Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS since the Train release, and this is recommended to provide a higher level of security. `LP#1964013 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1964013>`__ upgrade: - | The addition of libvirt SASL authentication requires a new password in ``passwords.yml``, ``libvirt_sasl_password``. This may be generated using the existing ``kolla-genpwd`` and ``kolla-mergepwd`` tooling. - | The addition of libvirt SASL authentication requires both the ``nova_libvirt`` and ``nova_compute`` containers to be updated simultaneously, using new images with the necessary Cyrus SASL dependencies, as well as configuration containing the SASL credentials.

libvirt: support SASL authentication

In Kolla Ansible OpenStack deployments, by default, libvirt is

facilitate migration between hosts.

internal network (and did not support it until Ussuri). However, most

commit_message:
Address RemovedInDjango40Warning (7)

HttpRequest.is_ajax() was marked as deprecated since Django 3.1 and will be
removed in Django 4.0 [1].

While the current implementation of is_ajax() relies on a jQuery-specific way
of signifying AJAX as noted in the Django relnotes, horizon works with this.
Thus this commit copies the existing logic of HttpRequest.is_ajax() to the
horizon repo (as horizon.utils.http.is_ajax()) and consumes it.

https: //docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.0/releases/3.1/#features-deprecated-in-3-1
Change-Id: I3def53033524985818a891a1b9d4659fad4ba2ba

commit_message:
Address RemovedInDjango40Warning (6)

Django 3.0 renamed is_safe_url() to url_has_allowed_host_and_scheme()
and deprecated is_safe_url().

https: //docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.0/releases/3.0/#deprecated-features-3-0

commit_message:
Address RemovedInDjango40Warning (5)

Django 3.1 deprecates {% ifequal %} template tag in favor of {% if %}
as {% if %} covers all use cases.

https: //docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.0/releases/3.1/#features-deprecated-in-3-1
Change-Id: Ief79fb4a08599ad94ed82f3e404620cc54a7eedf

subject: libvirt: support SASL authentication
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-10 10:23:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/376a271c7d3f55935bd6d3ccf9bfae4344ee8824', 'message': 'libvirt: support SASL authentication

In Kolla Ansible OpenStack deployments, by default, libvirt is
configured to allow read-write access via an unauthenticated,
unencrypted TCP connection, using the internal API network.  This is to
facilitate migration between hosts.

By default, Kolla Ansible does not use encryption for services on the
internal network (and did not support it until Ussuri). However, most
other services on the internal network are at least authenticated
(usually via passwords), ensuring that they cannot be used by anyone
with access to the network, unless they have credentials.

The main issue here is the lack of authentication. Any client with
access to the internal network is able to connect to the libvirt TCP
port and make arbitrary changes to the hypervisor. This could include
starting a VM, modifying an existing VM, etc. Given the flexibility of
the domain options, it could be seen as equivalent to having root access
to the hypervisor.

Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS [1] since the Train release, using
client and server certificates for mutual authentication and encryption.
However, this feature is not enabled by default, and requires
certificates to be generated for each compute host.

This change adds support for libvirt SASL authentication, and enables it
by default. This provides base level of security. Deployments requiring
further security should use libvirt TLS.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/compute/libvirt-guide.html#libvirt-tls

commit_message:
libvirt: support SASL authentication

In Kolla Ansible OpenStack deployments, by default, libvirt is
configured to allow read-write access via an unauthenticated,
unencrypted TCP connection, using the internal API network.  This is to
facilitate migration between hosts.

By default, Kolla Ansible does not use encryption for services on the
internal network (and did not support it until Ussuri). However, most
other services on the internal network are at least authenticated
(usually via passwords), ensuring that they cannot be used by anyone
with access to the network, unless they have credentials.

The main issue here is the lack of authentication. Any client with
access to the internal network is able to connect to the libvirt TCP
port and make arbitrary changes to the hypervisor. This could include
starting a VM, modifying an existing VM, etc. Given the flexibility of
the domain options, it could be seen as equivalent to having root access
to the hypervisor.

Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS [1] since the Train release, using
client and server certificates for mutual authentication and encryption.
However, this feature is not enabled by default, and requires
certificates to be generated for each compute host.

This change adds support for libvirt SASL authentication, and enables it
by default. This provides base level of security. Deployments requiring
further security should use libvirt TLS.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/compute/libvirt-guide.html#libvirt-tls

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/833021
Closes-Bug: #1964013
Change-Id: Ia91ceeb609e4cdb144433122b443028c0278b71e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/22/833022/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds support for libvirt SASL authentication. It is enabled by default. `LP#1964013 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1964013>`__ security: - | Fixes an issue where the default configuration of libvirt did not use authentication for the API exposed over TCP on the internal API network. This allowed anyone with access to the internal API network read-write access to libvirt. While the internal API network is typically trusted, other services on this network generally at least require authentication. SASL authentication is now enabled for libvirt by default. Kolla Ansible supports libvirt TLS since the Train release, and this is recommended to provide a higher level of security. `LP#1964013 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1964013>`__ upgrade: - | The addition of libvirt SASL authentication requires a new password in ``passwords.yml``, ``libvirt_sasl_password``. This may be generated using the existing ``kolla-genpwd`` and ``kolla-mergepwd`` tooling. - | The addition of libvirt SASL authentication requires both the ``nova_libvirt`` and ``nova_compute`` containers to be updated simultaneously, using new images with the necessary Cyrus SASL dependencies, as well as configuration containing the SASL credentials.
